issues.description: The problem statement refers to the REST endpoints as e.g. "PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents" (mentions the "/api" prefix), but the provided controller in both the template and solution exposes endpoints under "/persons/..." (no "/api" prefix). This mismatch can confuse students when they try to call the endpoints (e.g., in integration tests, curl commands, or when following the instructions) and may lead them to use the wrong URL path. It therefore creates a gap between the documented API paths and the actual routes in the starter code and reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the documented API paths and the controller routes consistent. Either: (A) update the problem statement to refer to endpoints without the "/api" prefix (e.g. "PUT /persons/{personId}/parents"), or (B) add the "/api" base path to the controller (for example, change the class-level annotation to @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...)) so the runtime routes match the documentation. Choose the option that aligns with the intended API naming convention for the course.
